deprec1: The above section only allows one item. Recreate your item in the section below.  To remove the section above remove the check mark in the configuration section (the cog) at the top of this column
Fumble4: Lose next attack, parry, and any Dodge.
Fumble7: Shield strap breaks; lose shield immediately.
Fumble8: Shield strap breaks; as above, and lose next attack.
Fumble9: Armor strap breaks and armor comes lose (roll for hit location to determine which piece of armor is lost).
Fumble10: Armor strap breaks, as above, and lose next attack and parry.
Fumble11: Fall and lose parry this round (takes 1D3 rounds to get up).
Fumble12: Twist ankle; lose half movement rate for 5D10 rounds.
Fumble13:
Fall and lose parry this round (takes 1D3 rounds to get up).
Twist ankle; lose half movement rate for 5D10 rounds.
Fumble14: Vision impaired; lose 25% effectiveness on attacks and parries (takes 1D3 rounds unengaged to clear vision)
Fumble15: Vision impaired; lose 50% effectiveness on attacks and parries (takes 1D6 rounds unengaged to clear vision)
Fumble16: Vision blocked; lose all attacks and parries (takes 1D6 rounds unengaged to clear vision).
Fumble17: Distracted; foes attack at +25% effectiveness for next round.
Fumble18:
Attack: Weapon used in attack dropped (takes 1D3 rounds to recover).
Parry: Parrying weapon or shield dropped (takes 1D3 rounds to recover).
Fumble19:
Attack: Weapon knocked away (roll 1D6 for number of meters it travels, and roll 1D8 for compass direction it goes;with 1=north, 2=northeast, 3=east, 4=southeast, 5=south, 6=southwest, 7=west, 8=northwest).
Parry: Parrying weapon or shield knocked away (roll 1D6 for number of meters it travels and 1D8 for compass direction it goes, as above).
Fumble20: Attack: Weapon shattered (100% chance if unenchanted; 10% less for each point of battle magic spell on weapon,and 20% less for each point of Rune magic spell on weapon).Parry: Parrying weapon or shield shattered (100% if unenchanted; 10% less for each point of battle magic on object,and 20% less for each point of Rune magic.)
Fumble21:
Attack: Hit nearest friend (hit self if no friend near); do rolled damage.
Parry: Wide open; foe automatically hits with normal damage
Fumble22:
b>Attack: Hit nearest friend (hit self if no friend near); do full possible damage.
Parry: Wide open; foe automatically hits with normal damage..
Fumble23:
Attack: Hit nearest friend (hit self if no friend near); do critical hit.
Parry: Wide open; foe automatically hits with normal damage.
Fumble24:
Attack: Hit self; do rolled damage.
Parry: Wide open; foe automatically hits with full possible damage.
Fumble25:
Attack: Hit self; do full possible damage.
Parry: Wide open; foe automatically critical hits.
Fumble26:
Attack: Hit self; do critical hit.
Parry: Wide open; foe automatically critical hits.
Fumble27: Blow it; roll twice on this table, and apply both results. If this result is rolled again, continue rolling until two other results are achieved.
Fumble28: Blow it badly; roll three times on this table, and apply all three results. If this result is rolled again, continue rolling until three other results are achieved.
Hit-on-the-Lower-L-Arm: Hit on the Lower L Arm
Hit-on-the-Lower-R-Arm: Hit on the Lower R Arm
Hit-on-the-Upper-R-Arm: Hit on the Upper R Arm
Hit-on-the-Upper-L-Arm: Hit on the Upper L Arm
Name: Name
